metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20786 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
libvterm through 0+bzr726, as used in Vim and other products, mishandlescertain out-of-memory conditions, leading to a denial of service(application crash), related to screen.c, state.c, and vterm.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvterm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
vim package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3').
